description: This Java source file defines the class MockLegacySirenRepeaterCluster, which extends MockLegacySecurityCluster and implements Tamperable and BatteryBackedUp interfaces. It models a mock security device component with capabilities to handle manufacturer commands related to siren modes, security panel status, and LED settings. The class also manages internal state for tampering, power loss, and battery conditions, providing methods to get and set these statuses, and generates status reports. It includes an internal enum for siren modes and a nested class for manufacturer commands.

classes.name: MockLegacySirenRepeaterCluster
classes.description: A mock cluster representing a legacy siren repeater device with tamper and power/battery status management, capable of handling manufacturer commands related to siren operation and status reporting.

classes.name: SirenMode
classes.description: Enumeration defining possible siren modes: off, fire, and burg.

classes.name: ClientMfgCommand
classes.description: Internal static class encapsulating manufacturer command byte identifiers for siren mode, panel status, and LED settings.

methods.name: handleMfgCommand
methods.description: Processes manufacturer commands based on the command ID and updates device status or logs information accordingly.

methods.name: getStatus
methods.description: Constructs and returns a byte array representing the current device status flags for tamper, power, and battery conditions.

methods.name: isTampered
methods.description: Returns whether the device is currently tampered.

methods.name: setTampered
methods.description: Sets the tampered status and triggers a status update if changed.

methods.name: isACPowerLost
methods.description: Checks if the AC power is lost.

methods.name: setACPowerLost
methods.description: Updates the AC power lost status and triggers a status update.

methods.name: isBatteryBad
methods.description: Checks if the battery is considered bad.

methods.name: setBatteryBad
methods.description: Updates the battery status and triggers a status update.

methods.name: isBatteryMissing
methods.description: Indicates whether battery missing detection is supported (always false).

methods.name: setBatteryMissing
methods.description: Warns that detection is not supported.
